Dear Mr. Doud, Jr.:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 8 and June 9, 2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also
violations of the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license license will be
issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will
result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Seven employees were reviewed. Two out of seven employees
did not have three references. One employee had one reference
in their file and the other employee had two references.
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(3) Sufficient health history information shall be
documented for each resident to assure proper medical
care.
Two youth files were reviewed. One out of two files did not have
sufficient health history information documented. The forms
created by the agency are sufficient. The writer did not provide
information in all sections.
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSA violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MSA requirements except for the following: NA
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following: NA
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.4112 (3) (K): The TB test results must be in before a staff can work with the
youth. The agency’s TB test date on two employees were after the hire date. This is
not a non-compliance unless they have worked with the youth. If the agency is going
to continue this pattern of testing, then there will need to be a “hire date” and then a
“work with youth” date present for verification of compliance of this rule. The agency
is free to decide how to incorporate this distinction in their personnel files.
R 400.4166 (a). The agency discharge forms have worker and supervisor signature
lines to verify completion of the reports. All of these forms should be signed and
dated.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
I discussed with the agency a need to have more structure surrounding the filing
process. Currently, the process for placing case notes and therapy notes into the
youth’s file happens at discharge. After reviewing discharged files, the therapy and case
notes were not filed. It would benefit the agency to have a more structured process.
This may include weekly updating the file (youth leave within 30 days). Or after
completion of case notes, printing them off and placing them in the file immediately. The
agency only had two youth for placement at the time of the audit so this may not feel as
immediate right now, but once the agency increases capacity, this area will be important
to stay current.
5

I also discussed forms being filled out completely. The agency forms are well written
and the writers should be filling out each section of the forms accurately and completely.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective
action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
